channel.title: RSCAngel full server source code
channel.description:
Server source code: http://rscangel.org/dev/rscangel_server_source.06.08.2010.tar.gz Javadoc help files: http://rscangel.org/dev/javadoc (largely incomplete but can still be useful) Client source code: http://rscangel.org/dev/client_src_svn.03.08.2010.tar.gz HOWTO/Tutorial: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,449584.0.html
If you create a server using this source code, it would be nice if you linked to a credits page containing:
[code] Jamie (Reines) eXemplar sean Meh Moose Matt (punKrock3r) xEnt Pets Ollie (KO9) Ryan Necroth google.com Zerattar Steve (rsclassicftw) [/code]

item.title: RSCAngel full server source code
item.dc:creator: @martinfin martinfin
item.description:
@martinfin wrote:

[quote=“KO9, post:30, topic:352689”][quote author=uberpk3r link=topic=449014.msg3299137#msg3299137 date=1281167942]
why no websiite, will be hard creating one for rsca source
[/quote]
You can use any RSCDv25 www files I believe. If not, you would only need some slight modifications to get it working properly. I’m available if anyone has any questions.

The main reason I’m not releasing the www files is because they aren’t really anything to do with RSC development. That and Peeter didn’t want the website files released, seeing as he wrote most of them I’ll respect his wishes.[/quote]

Here Here! As you stated above…RSCDv25 Web files will work…

Read full topic

item.title: RSCAngel full server source code
item.dc:creator: @sw0o0sh sw0o0sh
item.description:
@sw0o0sh wrote:

Who cares, there’s already one good server. If there’s anything that has been witnessed in the plethora of past servers it’s that the servers with the best active development stand the test of time. You’ll always be able to tell the half-ass server owners from the people who can get the job done. The average run time on a server with one line XML edits and free forums is anywhere from what, 3 hours to a week?

As for web files I’ve released some that are somewhere in this section that use Fluxbb etc, works perfectly if anyone has any concerns or conversions that are needed I can throw you a line on MSN. If you’re going with the regular PunBB I can show you how to secure them, it’s very easy to do with basic SQL/php knowledge. However, if you do use PunBB you’re going to have to upgrade the forum software as there’s many injection points that have been found since it was released 5 years ago.

As to Ollie respectable move, I’m not sure if anything will ever be done for the RSCD source “collectively” on “mopar” so to speak, but this will definitely set a very nice base for people to work with if they have their own path to travel.

Read full topic

item.title: RSCAngel full server source code
item.dc:creator: @Dehumanized Dehumanized
item.description:
@Dehumanized wrote:

[quote=“uberpk3r, post:29, topic:352689”][quote author=The_AFKer link=topic=449014.msg3298244#msg3298244 date=1281093451]
Why not sell the source privately? Do we really need 100+ more duplicates of somebody running the same shit?
[/quote]
Just grfo out please.

This is actually the best option, and I hope rsc will live longer becasue everyone will host the Best source[/quote]

That makes no sense.

Read full topic

item.title: RSCAngel full server source code
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

uberpk3r:

why no websiite, will be hard creating one for rsca source

You can use any RSCDv25 www files I believe. If not, you would only need some slight modifications to get it working properly. I’m available if anyone has any questions.

The main reason I’m not releasing the www files is because they aren’t really anything to do with RSC development. That and Peeter didn’t want the website files released, seeing as he wrote most of them I’ll respect his wishes.

Read full topic
